p: Grain legumes such as soybeans, peas, fava beans, and lentils are cultivated for their protein-rich seeds. Their amino acid composition is rich in lysine, leucine, aspartic acid, and arginine, but low in tryptophan and sulfur-containing methionine and cysteine [ 113]. The majority of storage proteins from legumes are salt-soluble globulins, followed by water-soluble albumins [ 114, 115].
